intro: Obione alexandrina, commonly known as the Alexandrian obione, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided lobes and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and phytochemical studies.
